additionalFields.bodyBack: Discover how Standard Bank Group transformed manual workflows into an automated insight engine using AWS and generative AI. Agentic tools autonomously gather content from a multitude of online sources, while Amazon Bedrock extracts key insights and generates comprehensive reporting. A custom UI enables conversational querying through a GraphRAG-enabled knowledge base. Learn how to implement prompt-chaining and design effective retrieval systems to unlock real-time intelligence from unstructured data.

additionalFields.heading: SUP203
additionalFields.title: State of Tech in Africa
additionalFields.body:
Henri Zietsman, Startup Business Development Manager, AWS | Christophe Viarnaud, CEO, AfricArena | Colin Illes, Growth Partner Chisl Group
12:00 - 12:45
additionalFields.bodyBack: Join us for an insightful exploration of Africa's tech landscape through the lens of startups, corporations, and investors. Drawing from AfricArena's annual State of Tech report, we'll analyze VC trends, high-performing sectors, and innovative startup success stories. Learn how founders navigate funding challenges and discover key opportunities in Africa's evolving tech ecosystem. Essential for startup founders and anyone interested in Africa's tech transformation.

additionalFields.heading: OIS204
additionalFields.title: Bridging the Digital Divide: Accessible eSigning for Mass Market Insurance
additionalFields.body:
Lee Moodley, Snr Solutions Architect, AWS | Carrie Peter, Managing Director, Impressions Signatures
15:00 - 15:45
additionalFields.bodyBack: Impression Signatures has disrupted the global Certificate Authority industry through their revolutionary use of AWS. This session highlights the specific AWS elements and products that allowed Impression to achieve one of the highest cyber security audits on the planet in order to become a globally recognised Certificate Authority. This breakthrough technology achieves rapid integration, improving digital transformation needs without compromising accessibility. AWS uptime and global reach combined with Impressions innovative USSD electronic signatures drives economic inclusion across the African continent. USSD works universally across all devices, bridging the digital divide and enabling continued operations during challenging periods.

additionalFields.heading: PTR203
additionalFields.title: Accelerating Cloud Excellence with AI-Powered AWS Management
additionalFields.body:
Clive Charlton, Director - Head of AWS (MEA), NTT DATA Inc. | Ryan Hendriks, Principal AWS Solutions Architect, NTT DATA Inc.
14:15 - 14:45
additionalFields.bodyBack: Discover operational excellence with AWS Managed Services by NTT DATA! Experience intelligent automation in infrastructure-as-code, SecOps and AWS Service Catalog. Our platform cuts costs by up to 40% while ensuring regulatory security and compliance. See Amazon Bedrock and AmazonQ automate infrastructure-as-code generation, transforming weeks into minutes, and reducing L1 support time and cost.

additionalFields.heading: CH1204
additionalFields.title: Migration and Modernization: Driving 25% AWS Cost Reduction While Enabling Sustainable Growth
additionalFields.body:
Maureen Kathure, Solution Architect, AWS | Francis Mwangi, Group Head of IT Security & Infrastructure, Platcorp Group
14:00 - 14:45
additionalFields.bodyBack: Today’s business leaders expect more than cost savings from cloud migrations — they need secure, resilient, and scalable platforms that drive long-term sustainability and innovation. Join this session to hear how Platcorp, a leading African fintech, developed a strategy with AWS that balanced pragmatic migration with modernization. Learn how this approach enhanced operational efficiency, supported financial inclusion, and unlocked the next wave of growth for Platcorp’s sustainable finance and microfinance operations.

additionalFields.heading: DAT305
additionalFields.title: Apache Iceberg and what it means for Analytics
additionalFields.body:
Felix Munyoki, Operations Manager, AWS | Raamy Schroeder, Engineer Mgr, Cloud: ITS Data Engineering, Woolworths
14:00 - 14:45
additionalFields.bodyBack: Woolworths migrated their analytics infrastructure from HUDI to Apache Iceberg, integrating it into their Enterprise Data Lake (EDL). The implementation leverages AWS Glue for processing, S3 for storage, and Redshift for user interactions. This session explores how Apache Iceberg's table format enhances analytics capabilities, improves data management, and enables better performance for large-scale data operations in modern cloud architectures.

additionalFields.heading: STU105
additionalFields.title: Introduction to Generative AI
additionalFields.body:
Nqobile Immaculate Qwabe, AWS
15:00 - 15:45
additionalFields.bodyBack: You'll learn about one of the hottest topics in the world of data science, generative AI. This session helps you to understand the technologies that make generative AI possible. You will be introduced to Artificial Intelligence (AI), Machine Learning (ML), and generative AI. The session concludes with a hands on PartyRock demo

additionalFields.heading: WPS202
additionalFields.title: Building FemmFloʼs AI-Enabled Health Chatbot in 8 Weeks
additionalFields.body:
Tal Cook, CEO and Author, Femmflo
13:00 - 13:45
additionalFields.bodyBack: FemmFlo, a FemTech startup, partnered with Melio AI to create a personalized health assistant using AWS in 8 weeks. The AI solution addresses the challenge of complex medical reports by converting lab PDFs and health data into user-friendly, conversational insights. Without an internal AI team, FemmFlo leveraged AWS tools and Melio's AI-as-a-Service to build an MVP chat interface, demonstrating how small teams can tackle healthcare challenges efficiently while maintaining cost-effectiveness and reliability.

additionalFields.heading: BIZ206
additionalFields.title: Improving the contact experience through generative AI
additionalFields.body:
Peter Littlefield, Senior Solutions Architect, AWS | Yashika Naicker, Chief Technology Officer, Rewardsco | Keenen Moodley, Head of Information Security and Fraud, Rewardsco
13:00 - 13:45
additionalFields.bodyBack: Discover how Rewardsco transformed their contact centre operations through AI-driven quality assurance, compliance and real-time sentiment analysis. Learn how their innovative solution has redefined quality management by enabling quality assurance assessors to shift from manual evaluations to impactful coaching while delivering accelerated agent feedback at scale. From quicker agent onboarding, improved performance monitoring, and enhanced customer satisfaction, see how generative AI has empowered both assessors and agents to maintain service excellence.

additionalFields.heading: AIM206
additionalFields.title: Responsible AI: From theory to practice with AWS
additionalFields.body:
Kgomotso Welcome, Solutions Architect, AWS | Lwando Maciti, AI Engineer, Old Mutual
15:00 - 15:45
additionalFields.bodyBack: The rapid growth of generative AI brings promising innovation but raises new challenges around its safe and responsible development and use. While challenges like bias and explainability were common before generative AI, large language models bring new challenges like hallucination and toxicity. Join this session to understand how your organization can begin its responsible AI journey. Get an overview of the challenges related to generative AI, and learn about the responsible AI in action at AWS, including the tools AWS offers.

additionalFields.heading: DAT204
additionalFields.title: Modern Data Architecture for payments
additionalFields.body:
Ikechukwu Okorie, Solution Architect, AWS | Maureen Kathure, Solutions Architect, AWS | Kodjo Hesse, Founder and IT Director, Express Pay
13:00 - 13:45
additionalFields.bodyBack: Express Pay is a leader payments provider in Ghana that champions innovation. The company built a single platform (processor, acquirer, gateway and risk engine) from the ground utilizing modern technology available with AWS. Utilizing AWS serverless technology, including AWS Lambda, Amazon Aurora and Amazon Q, Express pay have developed a cutting-edge solution. This advanced payment platform ensures secure and smooth payment processing across digital channels in Ghana

additionalFields.heading: CH1303
additionalFields.title: Demystifying EC2: The Magic Behind Instance Launch
additionalFields.body:
Bianca Haarhof, Senior Manager Software Development, AWS | Francois de Villiers, Principal Software Engineer, AWS
13:00 - 13:45
additionalFields.bodyBack: Step inside the engine room of AWS as Cape Town engineers reveal the fascinating mechanics of EC2 instance launches. From the service's origins in South Africa to its evolution into a global powerhouse, discover the hidden complexity, split-second decisions, and sophisticated orchestration that powers millions of launches daily. Get exclusive insights from the team that built and continues to innovate one of AWS's most fundamental services.

additionalFields.heading: AIM303
additionalFields.title: Training African language foundation models with Lelapa AI and AWS Machine Learning Services
additionalFields.body:
Nicolas David, Startup Solutions Architect, AWS | Jade Abbott, CTO and co-founder, Lelapa AI
12:00 - 12:45
additionalFields.bodyBack: Lelapa.AI is a socially-grounded Africa-centric AI research & product lab, and are pioneering foundation model training on the continent. Learn how Lelapa AI has leveraged AWS environments to support their ambition of building resource efficient AI solutions and African language focused FMs. Building and training foundation models is a journey. Hear about FM training options on AWS, from local training jobs in EC2 all the way to how Amazon SageMaker Pipelines can automate FM training at scale for customers of all sizes and industries.

additionalFields.heading: WPS305
additionalFields.title: Backup and disaster recovery strategies for increased resilience
additionalFields.body:
Temitope Oyenuga, Senior Technical Account Manager, AWS
16:00 - 16:45
additionalFields.bodyBack: Learn strategies for using AWS services to use AWS elasticity to protect your server-based applications, whether they are on premises or in the cloud, from downtime and data loss. This session offers a deep dive into how AWS Elastic Disaster Recovery can help organizations achieve RPO of seconds and RTO of minutes. It also covers how Elastic Disaster Recovery helps organizations protect against, respond to, and recover from ransomware events. Learn how you can combine this solution with AWS Backup for comprehensive data protection.

additionalFields.heading: CH2101
additionalFields.title: AI Meets Support: The Future of AWS Engineering
additionalFields.body: Emmanuel Mashandudze, Senior Cloud Support Engineer, AWS | Gali Morake, Cloud Support Engineer, AWS | Joseph Phiri, Cloud Support Engineer, AWS
additionalFields.bodyBack: Explore the dual impact of generative AI in AWS Support: how it's reshaping customer support needs and how we're leveraging AI to enhance our support capabilities. Learn how AWS Support Engineers are adapting to AI-driven workloads while using AI tools to deliver more efficient, innovative solutions for our customers.

additionalFields.heading: GAI206
additionalFields.title: Proactive Employee Care: Leveraging AWS Bedrock for Workforce Well-being and Cultural Insights
additionalFields.body:
Losika Monang, Solutions Architect, AWS | Christian Kamwangala, AIML and GenAI Specialist SA, AWS | David Kariuki, CEO, Therapa AI
15:00 - 15:45
additionalFields.bodyBack: Organizations struggle to detect and address employee well-being issues and cultural challenges before they impact productivity and retention. Therapa's HR Console leverages AWS Bedrock to create a comprehensive solution that monitors workforce mental health signals and cultural patterns in real time. In this session, discover how we implemented Bedrock's Claude models to power our three-pillar approach: quantitative well-being metrics, LLM-powered semantic trend analysis, and intelligent action recommendations. Learn how Bedrock's agentic capabilities enable multi-agent collaboration for different HR personas, from detecting early burn-out warnings to surfacing DEI concerns. We'll demonstrate how action groups orchestrate contextual interventions while maintaining privacy-first design principles and human oversight.

additionalFields.heading: PTR205
additionalFields.title: From Digital to Value Twins
additionalFields.body:
Rudzani Mulaudzi
12:45 - 13:15
additionalFields.bodyBack: Exploring the concept of Digital Twins, which are virtual replicas of physical entities, systems, or networks, used for monitoring, diagnostics, and predictive maintenance. Highlighting their application in manufacturing, smart cities, and aerospace, emphasising real-time data syncing and analytics.

additionalFields.heading: TRN205
additionalFields.title: Code with a generative AI powered assistant - Amazon Q Developer
additionalFields.body:
Mabuya Brightwell Magagula, Senior Technical Trainer,AWS
15:00 - 15:45
additionalFields.bodyBack: Amazon Q Developer is a generative AI–powered assistant that helps you understand, build, extend, and operate AWS applications throughout the software development lifecycle. In this breakout session, learn about the benefits, features, typical use cases, technical concepts, and cost of using Amazon Q Developer. Review an architecture that uses Amazon Q Developer in interactive and asynchronous environments to chat with applications and customize and transform code.

additionalFields.heading: PTN110
additionalFields.title: Turning Human Risk into Resilient Security.
additionalFields.body:
Adenike Cosgrove, CMO, Mimecast
14:20 - 14:35
additionalFields.bodyBack: Traditional security programs leave security leaders unable to proactively identify high-risk employees or effectively mitigate risky behavior. Learn how organizations can now transform the way they mitigate employee risk by focusing on the human, while mitigating both external and internal risks.

additionalFields.heading: CH2305
additionalFields.title: Payments Platform at Scale: Processing 10M transactions daily
additionalFields.body:
Maureen Kathure, Solutions Architect, AWS | Francis Wilson, CIO, Hubtel | Augustine Gyawu Adjei, Head of Engineering, Hubtel
15:00 - 15:45
additionalFields.bodyBack: Hubtel has grown into Ghana’s largest mobile payments platform after the company migrated from an inflexible and unreliable on-premises infrastructure to AWS. Traffic spikes were affecting platform performance because it was taking too long to scale its infrastructure. The company migrated to AWS using Amazon EC2, Amazon RDS, and Amazon EKS. Hubtel’s infrastructure now scales easily to meet demand. It has increased revenue by 20 times and improved performance 100 times, while saving $1.5 million annually on infrastructure costs.

additionalFields.heading: NET202
additionalFields.title: Build without limits with AWS Cloud infrastructure
additionalFields.body:
Ashraf Altalleh, Senior Solutions Architect, AWS
13:00 - 13:45
additionalFields.bodyBack: Organizations of all sizes are looking to solve big challenges, turn ideas into reality, and innovate faster. This requires a secure and reliable infrastructure that delivers high performance at low costs and scales without limits, while offering technology choices tailored to an organization’s specific needs. In this session, learn how builders are using AWS Cloud infrastructure to create and run critical applications that meet customer and business needs. Explore AWS innovations, starting from the silicon and extending to data centers across the globe. Discover how AWS can accelerate innovation, improve efficiency, and support global scale for your organization.

additionalFields.heading: CH2303
additionalFields.title: Building EC2: Inside AWS Cape Town Engineering
additionalFields.body:
Jethro Moller, Software Development Engineer, AWS | Tai Lucas, Principal System Development Engineer, AWS
14:00 - 14:45
additionalFields.bodyBack: Join AWS EC2 engineers for an insider’s view of building and operating one of the world’s largest compute platforms. Experience a day in our Cape Town engineering centre, where we’ll share our development practices, operational excellence, and innovation culture. Discover how our teams collaborate globally while solving complex challenges that impact millions of customers. Get unique perspectives on engineering at AWS scale from the team that helps power the cloud.

additionalFields.heading: NET303
additionalFields.title: Centralized Inspection at scale: Cloud WAN vs Transit Gateway
additionalFields.body:
Joseph Mutua, Sr. Solutions Architect, AWS
14:00 - 14:45
additionalFields.bodyBack: AWS Centralized Inspection at scale is essentially a security architecture pattern that lets you inspect all your network traffic through a single, centralized location instead of setting up security tools in each individual network. In this session, we will see how to setup Centralized Inspection at scale with Cloud WAN, and Transit Gateway, differences between the two, and benefits

additionalFields.heading: PTN103
additionalFields.title: Open Telemetry – The Future Is Here
additionalFields.body:
Sascha Giese, Global Tech Evangelist, Observability, SolarWinds
12:20 - 12:35
additionalFields.bodyBack: Open Telemetry is not just another hype that goes away. There are reasons why the support grows and remains vendor-agnostic. This session aims to get you up to date on Open Telemetry and will show a few tips on using it, with an example of SolarWinds Observability SaaS.

additionalFields.heading: BIZ205
additionalFields.title: Building a Serverless FinOps Data Lake
additionalFields.body:
Jorge Lobo, CSR Manager, AWS | Tinstwalo Kissey Mhelembe, FinOps Lead Practitioner, Old Mutual South Africa | Catherine Lückhoff, CEO, 20Fifty
14:00 - 14:45
additionalFields.bodyBack: Our FinOps practitioners previously struggled with time-consuming manual processes, spending up to 22 days per month generating critical chargeback reports through complex Athena queries and intricate Excel manipulations. By shifting left and treating cost data as a crucial product requirement, we engineered a serverless data lake solution that automates the ETL workflows and makes data available in real time, reducing monthly report generation from 22 days to less than a week while eliminating error-prone manual processes.

additionalFields.heading: SUP201
additionalFields.title: AWS Rocketfuel for Start-up
additionalFields.body:
Abhisekh Baid, Startup Engaged Lead, AWS
09:00 - 09:30
additionalFields.bodyBack: There's a reason why over 80% of startup unicorns are on AWS! AWS is known for helping startups grow and scale. For over 14 years, we’ve been supporting the world’s most successful startups as they build on AWS, throughout their journey from early stage to scaleup. Join us to hear the journey of a SSA-homegrown Startup and the role technology will play in driving their vision forward.

additionalFields.heading: GAI101
additionalFields.title: Gen AI in action: from POC to business value
additionalFields.body:
Jason Nicholls, Principal Solutions Architect, AWS
09:00 - 09:30
additionalFields.bodyBack: More global leaders like Bundesliga and Trellix are taking their generative AI applications to production and realizing business impact through increased innovation, productivity, and cost savings. How are they achieving these benefits and what are the key priorities that are critical for success? Through training, professional services experts, and comprehensive generative AI offerings, AWS provides trusted guidance and tools for customers to scale with confidence. In this session, learn how new services and models like Amazon Nova, Amazon Bedrock, and Amazon Q are delivering business value across use cases to enhance customer engagement and boost employee productivity.

additionalFields.heading: COM203
additionalFields.title: AI-Driven Risks in Securing Enterprise Serverless Systems on AWS
additionalFields.body:
Daniel Clement, DevOps Engineer, ACS - AWS Community Builder |
12:00 - 12:45
additionalFields.bodyBack: As enterprises rapidly adopt serverless computing and integrate artificial intelligence (AI) into their cloud-native systems, new dimensions of risk emerge. This session explores the complex interplay between AI technologies and serverless systems, examining how AI both strengthens and undermines security in these environments. Through case studies, vulnerability analysis, and proposed mitigation frameworks, identify specific AI-induced threats to serverless systems, evaluate current defense mechanisms, and propose practical strategies for securing enterprise deployments.

additionalFields.heading: PTN304
additionalFields.title: Melly AI Fraud Detection
additionalFields.body:
Muhideen Adedeji, CTO, Datamellon | Olutimilehin Oyesanya, Group Head, Technology Compliance, Sterling Financial Holdings Company Plc
12:40 - 12:55
additionalFields.bodyBack: This is an AI-powered, comprehensive solution designed to protect financial institutions from fraudulent activities through real-time transaction monitoring, advanced analytics, and automated decision-making capabilities. The system provides a suite of APIs that enable banks and financial service providers to integrate sophisticated fraud detection mechanisms into their existing applications.

additionalFields.heading: TRN206
additionalFields.title: Are you well-architected?
additionalFields.body:
Thembelani Sigala Mhlanga, AWS Technical Trainer,AWS
16:00 - 16:45
additionalFields.bodyBack: Most businesses depend on a portfolio of technology solutions to operate and be successful every day. How do you know if you and your team are following best practice or what the risks in your architectures might be? In this session, learn how the AWS Well-Architected Framework provides prescriptive architectural advice and how the AWS Well-Architected Tool helps you measure and improve your technology portfolio.

additionalFields.heading: COM202
additionalFields.title: MAYDAY! Monkeys on the loose in Production!
additionalFields.body:
Hennie Francis, Senior Cloud Engineer, Capitec Bank
09:45 - 10:15
additionalFields.bodyBack: Imagine a cheeky monkey running wild through your production environment, stirring up trouble just to see how your system holds up. Its mission? To throw everything at your app—unexpected crashes, random server shutdowns, network hiccups—just to see if it can stay standing when the chaos hits. Unleash chaos, embrace the madness, and strengthen your system. Join me to see how intentional disruption can make your app more resilient. We’ll guide you through testing your system under pressure and using the results to build a more reliable, battle-hardened app ready for anything. 🐒💥

additionalFields.heading: CH1205
additionalFields.title: Modernising a Fintech Platform: Cloud-Native Best Practices That Scale
additionalFields.body:
Asif Hamza, Solutions Architect, AWS | Seagyn Davis, Field CTO, LSD Open | David Beretta, Lead Engineer, Finch Technologies
15:00 - 15:45
additionalFields.bodyBack: What does it take to prepare your platform for rapid scale, without slowing down delivery or compromising reliability? In this chalk talk, we’ll share how LSD Open partnered with Gathr (powered by Finch Technologies) to modernise their AWS environment, enabling them to grow confidently, ship faster, and support more users without platform overhead. We’ll walk through the transformation from a single, shared AWS environment to a secure, automated, and production-ready platform built for scale. You’ll learn how we: * Established best-practice AWS foundations with secure multi-account structure and infrastructure-as-code * Enabled rapid application scaling and faster time-to-market using Amazon EKS * Helped refactor and containerise workloads for improved performance and resilience * Set up observability and cost controls to support proactive operations This is a practical, interactive session for technical leads and platform teams looking to move faster on AWS without creating long-term debt. Bring your questions, we’ll go deep on tooling, process, and pitfalls to avoid.

additionalFields.heading: WS301
additionalFields.title: Boost Developer Productivity with Amazon Q Developer
additionalFields.body:
Sizwe Molefe, Solutions Architect, AWS | Abulele Mditshwa, Solutions Architect, AWS
09:00 - 10:15
additionalFields.bodyBack: Discover how AI-powered automation and intelligent code assistance can reduce friction, speed up development cycles, and improve code quality. Explore real-world use cases like AI-driven code reviews, automated testing, and smart documentation generation. Learn how to seamlessly integrate these tools into your workflows to boost efficiency, enhance collaboration, and elevate the developer experience—all while ensuring security and compliance. You will need a laptop to participate.

additionalFields.heading: STU102
additionalFields.title: Building a Cloud Career
additionalFields.body:
Nqobile Immaculate Qwabe, AWS
12:00 - 12:45
additionalFields.bodyBack: You will learn to identify the next steps in your personal career journey. You will also learn to identify important goals in a cloud career and how to identify the training and skills you need to achieve your goals

additionalFields.heading: STU103
additionalFields.title: CV to Interview: Navigating Tech Recruitment
additionalFields.body:
Petra Neilon, AWS | Natasha Fay, AWS
13:00 - 13:45
additionalFields.bodyBack: You'll learn about crafting a standout CV and how to navigate the job application and tech interview process. You'll gain insights into Amazon's leadership principles-based interviews and common tech interview techniques, preparing you for AWS and broader tech career opportunities.

additionalFields.heading: WPS105
additionalFields.title: Backup and disaster recovery strategies for increased resilience
additionalFields.body: Temitope Oyenuga, Senior Technical Account Manager, AWS
additionalFields.bodyBack: Learn strategies for using AWS services to use AWS elasticity to protect your server-based applications, whether they are on premises or in the cloud, from downtime and data loss. This session offers a deep dive into how AWS Elastic Disaster Recovery can help organizations achieve RPO of seconds and RTO of minutes. It also covers how Elastic Disaster Recovery helps organizations protect against, respond to, and recover from ransomware events. Learn how you can combine this solution with AWS Backup for comprehensive data protection.

additionalFields.heading: PTN201
additionalFields.title: Diving Deep into the Iceberg Data Lake with Snowflake
additionalFields.body:
Dan Hunt
12:00 - 12:15
additionalFields.bodyBack: Discover Snowflake's Iceberg support for open-format flexibility, without management headaches. Learn to rapidly migrate from CSV/Parquet, streamline governance with Snowflake and Polaris, and implement key data engineering practices, including GenAI augmentation. Join us for a live demo of Snowflake orchestrating advanced Iceberg data transformations.

additionalFields.heading: WPS101
additionalFields.title: How not to sabotage your transformation
additionalFields.body:
Anica Maharaj, Principal Engagement Manager, AWS | Nolan Venkiah, Senior Delivery Consultant
12:00 - 12:45
additionalFields.bodyBack: The importance of transformation remains a key concern for C-level executives in many organizations as they recognize their current operating model is hindering progress. Drawing from numerous engagements with executives from leading global organizations combined with insights from Amazon's experiences and research, the Enterprise Strategy team at AWS has identified patterns of success and failure in organizational transformation.

additionalFields.heading: BIZ302
additionalFields.title: Fleet Tracking at Scale: Building for 4M Daily Transactions
additionalFields.body:
Jason Nicholls, Principal Solutions Architect, AWS | Danie Du Plessis, Lead Solutions Architect, FuseIT
16:00 - 16:45
additionalFields.bodyBack: Journey into the architecture and engineering decisions behind a high-performance system processing over 4 million transactions daily. This session reveals how we collaborated with the AWS Location Services team to architect a robust, enterprise-grade vehicle and asset tracking solution that seamlessly scales with demand. Discover the challenges we overcame, the critical design patterns we implemented, and how we leveraged AWS's location-based services to deliver real-time tracking at massive scale.

additionalFields.heading: NET301
additionalFields.title: Patterns for PrivateLink and VPC Lattice for Hybrid Networks
additionalFields.body:
Kaveer Harie, Senior Solutions Architect, AWS
12:00 - 12:45
additionalFields.bodyBack: Amazon VPC Lattice is an application networking service that simplifies connecting, securing, and monitoring service-to-service communication. You can use VPC Lattice to facilitate cross-account and cross-VPC connectivity, as well as application layer load balancing for your workloads in a consistent way regardless of the underlying compute type—instances, containers, and serverless. In this session, get a general overview of VPC Lattice, learn about the latest features and functionality, discover pro tips and tricks to adopt best practices, and explore top architecture patterns organizations use to simplify application connectivity, security, and load balancing.

additionalFields.heading: OIS200
additionalFields.title: CISO Roundtable
additionalFields.body:
Elton Paka, Solutions Architect | Tommie Francis
08:00 - 10:00
additionalFields.bodyBack: CISO Roundtable

additionalFields.heading: PTN312
additionalFields.title: Your Next User Isn’t Human: Agentic AI in Action
additionalFields.body:
Kieron Ekron
14:40 - 14:55
additionalFields.bodyBack: Agentic AI shifts the paradigm, and autonomous systems now act as users, collaborators, and decision-makers. This session explores practical architectures, emerging design patterns, and the implications of treating AI agents as first-class users across AWS services. Learn how to build for a world where your next user might be an AI.

additionalFields.heading: STU101
additionalFields.title: Introduction to the AWS Cloud
additionalFields.body:
Mabuya Brightwell Magagula, AWS
09:15 - 10:00
additionalFields.bodyBack: You will be introduced to the AWS cloud to better understand the meaning of “the cloud”. You will learn about the AWS cloud model and its core services, how the cloud is used, and how the shared responsibility model impacts design decisions. The course concludes with a brief introduction of cloud careers and the possible next steps in the learner’s cloud journey.

additionalFields.heading: NET204
additionalFields.title: Mastering resilience at every layer of the cake
additionalFields.body:
Temitope Oyenuga, Sr. Technical Account Manager, AWS
15:00 - 15:45
additionalFields.bodyBack: Most workloads on AWS resemble a finely crafted cake, with delight at every layer. In this session, master resilience at each layer of deliciousness: from platform to infrastructure and applications, using services like AWS Resilience Hub, AWS Fault Injection Service (FIS), Amazon Route53 ARC, Amazon Elastic Disaster Recovery (DRS), AWS Backup, and more. Leave with a mental model for how resilience works throughout these layers, with ready-to-use reference architectures and prescriptive guidance.

additionalFields.heading: CH1306
additionalFields.title: Mastering AWS Landing Zones: Zero to Hero
additionalFields.body:
Kennedy Masunda, Technical Account Manager, AWS | Shantal Varathan, Technical Account Manager, AWS
16:00 - 16:45
additionalFields.bodyBack: Unleash the full potential of AWS Control Tower in your cloud journey! Discover powerful strategies for automated account provisioning, custom landing zones, and intelligent guardrails. Learn how to create a dynamic governance framework that grows with your business by integrating Control Tower, Organizations, and Config. Perfect for those ready to take their AWS environment to the next level.

additionalFields.heading: PTN108
additionalFields.title: Use GenAi to control your cloud
additionalFields.body:
David Christie
13:20 - 13:35
additionalFields.bodyBack: Accenture showcases assets it's built to help clients control and manage their cloud estate using GenAi. All companies are facing an ever evolving tooling landscape, cost spikes, unplanned deployments and security risks, with Accenture Cockpit and Glass clients are able to seamlessly manage their estate.

additionalFields.heading: AIM304
additionalFields.title: Accelerate ML workflows with Amazon SageMaker Studio and Sanlam
additionalFields.body:
Craig Mullins, Solutions Architect, AWS | Vedanth Baiju, Head of Data Science, Sanlam | Harry Lee, Co-Founder and CTO, Melio.ai
13:00 - 13:45
additionalFields.bodyBack: Unlock the power of Amazon SageMaker Studio, a comprehensive IDE for streamlining the machine learning (ML) lifecycle. Explore data exploration, transformation, automated feature engineering with AutoML, and collaborative coding using integrated Jupyter Notebooks. Discover how SageMaker Studio MLOps integration simplifies model deployment, monitoring, and governance. Through live demos and best practices, learn to leverage SageMaker Studio tools for efficient feature engineering, model development, collaboration, and data security. Learn how Sanlam, a major African financial services group, implemented an enterprise MLOps platform on Amazon SageMaker in just 3.5 months. The project included building CI/CD pipelines, monitoring systems, and governance frameworks, while migrating specific models from external tools. The initiative succeeded in creating a reproducible, auditable ML development environment that gained wide adoption among data science teams by leveraging native AWS tools.

additionalFields.heading: KEY101
additionalFields.title: Keynote
additionalFields.body:
Willem Visser, VP of Amazon EC2, AWS EMEA Vice President Tanuja Randery, General Manager for Sub-Saharan Africa, Jyoti Ball | Willem Visser, VP Amazon EC2 | Tanuja Randery, AWS EMEA Vice President | Jyoti Ball, General Manager for Sub-Saharan Africa | Azhar Said - Chief Data Officer at Capitec | Dr Leila Fourie the Goup Chief Executive Officer
10:30 - 11:30
additionalFields.bodyBack: Join distinguished speakers for our executive keynote session featuring Willem Visser, VP of Amazon EC2, AWS EMEA Vice President Tanuja Randery, General Manager for Sub-Saharan Africa, Jyoti Ball and Dr Leila Fourie the Goup Chief Executive Officer, Johannesburg Stock Exchange. This keynote includes a special presentation from Azhar Said - Chief Data Officer at Capitec, one of Africa's leading financial services groups, highlighting their cloud transformation journey. The session and leadership panel will address regional cloud innovation,innovation,global AWS technologies, and strategic digital transformation, showcasing how enterprises across South Africa and the broader African continent are achieving operational excellence through Cloud solutions.

additionalFields.heading: OIS205
additionalFields.title: Implementing security best practices for serverless applications
additionalFields.body:
Elton Paka, Solutions Architect, AWS | Shadrack Anyuo, Solutions Architect, AWS
16:00 - 16:45
additionalFields.bodyBack: Building with serverless enables organizations to build and deploy applications without managing underlying infrastructure. Serverless strengthens your overall security posture by reducing attack surface and shifting security operations to AWS. In this session, explore how to implement security best practices across the software delivery lifecycle and into production deployment. Hear lessons learned from working with numerous enterprise customers that can help your builders be productive and innovative within security guardrails.

additionalFields.heading: DAT203
additionalFields.title: Scaling Success : How Spur Corporation's AWS-Powered Loyalty Program is Revolutionizing Restaurant Customer Engagement
additionalFields.body:
Sajith Pushpangadhan, Senior Solutions Architect, AWS | Paul Casarin, Chief Information Officer, Spur | Gabriel Roux, Director of Solutions Architecture, Spur
12:00 - 12:45
additionalFields.bodyBack: Discover how Spur Corporation, a leading South African restaurant group, leveraged AWS to build and scale its award-winning loyalty program. This case study explores how Spur's transition to an in-house loyalty engine on AWS led to improved customer experiences, increased member spending, and significant cost savings. Learn about the technical architecture behind their success and how AWS services enabled Spur to process 50% of their turnover through their loyalty program, driving a 30% increase in member spending.

additionalFields.heading: CH2302
additionalFields.title: SnapMagic: AI-Powered Trading Card Generation
additionalFields.body:
Merlin Naidoo, Technical Account Manager, AWS | Patrick Chen, Cloud Support Engineer, AWS
12:00 - 12:45
additionalFields.bodyBack: Transform any AWS event into an unforgettable experience with SnapMagic's AI-powered trading card platform. Using Amazon Bedrock's Nova Canvas and Nova Reel models, attendees can instantly generate personalized professional trading cards and animated videos from simple text prompts. Built on serverless AWS architecture, SnapMagic delivers enterprise-grade scalability while making generative AI accessible to everyone at events literally in the palm of your hands.

additionalFields.heading: BIZ204
additionalFields.title: Road Accident Fund System Modernisation
additionalFields.body:
Lionel Khoza, Head of Government, AWS | Sello Lehong, Head: Technology & Digital, Road Accident Fund
15:00 - 15:45
additionalFields.bodyBack: The Road Accident Fund (RAF) made a strategic decision to reduce operational and administrative costs while improving claims settlement efficiency through digitization. Their focus on system modernization includes: Implementing an integrated claims management system, Digitizing processes and Enhancing cybersecurity. RAF selected AWS as a key strategic partner to drive their desired outcomes, which among others include focusing settling claims within 120 days.

additionalFields.heading: CH1202
additionalFields.title: VMware to AWS: Technical Considerations & Accelerators
additionalFields.body:
Dennis Kieselhorst, Principal Solutions Architect, AWS | Peter Littlefield, Senior Solutions Architect, AWS
12:00 - 12:45
additionalFields.bodyBack: Migrating VMware workloads to AWS demands strategic planning and technical precision. This chalk talk provides a comprehensive roadmap covering business case development, discovery tools, AWS foundations, and migration solutions. Explore key AWS services including AWS Application Discovery Service, AWS Application Migration Service, and the new agentic AI service AWS Transform that accelerates infrastructure, application, and code transformation. Learn how these AI-powered tools automate and optimize your migration journey. Gain practical insights into technical decisions for each migration phase and leave ready to confidently transition to AWS with minimal disruption.

additionalFields.heading: GAI205
additionalFields.title: King Price Life : Making funeral insurance accessible
additionalFields.body:
Ikechukwu Okorie, Senior Solutions Architect, AWS | Charl Naudé, Chief Technical Officer, King Price Life | Christian Arts, Solutions Architect, King Price Life
14:00 - 14:45
additionalFields.bodyBack: Experience how King Price Life transforms funeral insurance accessibility through WhatsApp-first customer engagement. This innovative platform enables seamless funeral policy applications and document uploads without agent intervention. Learn how their omni-channel solution combines self-service convenience with on-demand agent support, enhanced by sentiment analysis for superior customer experience.

additionalFields.heading: WPS204
additionalFields.title: Empowering Student Access to Higher Ed with the AWS Cloud
additionalFields.body:
Agnat Max Makgoale, Senior Account Manager, AWS | Amitha Lakkakula, Solutions Architect, AWS | Thulani Malula, CIO, National Student Financial Aid Scheme
15:00 - 15:45
additionalFields.bodyBack: The National Student Financial Aid Scheme (NSFAS) in South Africa leveraged AWS to modernize its student aid platform, enhance data analytics, and streamline operations. By migrating to the cloud, NSFAS improved scalability, security, and student support, positioning itself to better serve the evolving needs of 1.1 million underprivileged learners seeking access to higher education disbursing R34 Billion. SFAS This session shares how NSFAS' uses the AWS cloud to drive operational excellence and mission impact.

additionalFields.heading: COM104
additionalFields.title: How I Built MzansiShopper, An AI-Powered Retail Assistant for Personalized Shopping
additionalFields.body:
Adeline Makokha, Software Quality Engineer, Safaricom PLC
13:00 - 13:45
additionalFields.bodyBack: In this talk, I will share how I built MzansiShopper, an AI-powered retail assistant designed to transform the shopping experience for South African consumers. Using AWS services like Lex, Personalize, Translate, and DynamoDB, all deployed and automated with AWS CLI. I created a solution that delivers personalized product recommendations. I’ll walk through the deployment process, and lessons learned, showing how accessible AWS tools can help solve real-world challenges and drive digital inclusion in South Africa’s retail sector.

additionalFields.heading: GAI207
additionalFields.title: Revolutionizing Enterprise Modernization: AWS Transform and the Next Wave of Generative AI
additionalFields.body:
Siyakudumisa Kwinana, Solutions Architect, AWS | Tiego Mohlaba, Proserve Delivery Consultant, AWS
16:00 - 16:45
additionalFields.bodyBack: Discover AWS Transform, a revolutionary agentic AI service redefining enterprise modernization. Learn how it leverages specialized AI agents to automate transformation of .NET, mainframe, and VMware workloads at scale. Built on decades of migration expertise, AWS Transform uses advanced technologies like LLMs and Graph Neural Networks to streamline modernization tasks. We'll demonstrate how its collaborative workspaces and intelligent coordination system can help modernize hundreds of applications simultaneously, reducing timelines and costs while maintaining quality. Additionally, we'll explore the latest developments in AWS's Generative AI offerings, including updates to Amazon Bedrock and Amazon Q.

additionalFields.heading: SUP202
additionalFields.title: Startup Spotlight: Next-Gen Solutions Built on AWS
additionalFields.body:
Rafael Jankowski, CSR Manager, AWS
09:45 - 10:15
additionalFields.bodyBack: Experience the future of innovation as startups showcase their AWS-powered solutions. From AI-driven applications to smart SaaS platforms, witness firsthand how these startups are reshaping their industries.

additionalFields.heading: NET305
additionalFields.title: Adopt AWS operations management culture on your team
additionalFields.body:
Hayden Stone, Delivery Manager, AWS | Faadilah Jacobs, Lead - Cloud Operations, Standard Bank
16:00 - 16:45
additionalFields.bodyBack: AWS knows that service reliability is something that you rely on. , learn how Amazon has used cultural and technical mechanisms to help teams more effectively operate in a decentralized organization, especially for critical processes like incident management. Dive into the mechanisms and tools that AWS on-call operators use to triage, prioritize, respond to, and mitigate events while exploring how the Amazon culture influences all of these. This talk breaks down and shares the practical methodologies and tools that AWS uses to ensure a low day-to-day ops load and a lower mean time to resolution (MTTR) for incidents.

additionalFields.heading: PTN215
additionalFields.title: AgriTech AI Applied: A Developmenthub Perspective
additionalFields.body:
Odwa Ndyaluvane, Managing Director, Developmenthub (Pty) Ltd
15:20 - 15:35
additionalFields.bodyBack: The presentation covers how Developmenthub, through our product, Livestock Affairs, is solving SADC challenges like farm killings, livestock theft, and traceability using AWS-powered AI. It showcases features such as livestock recognition, valuation models, a vet-grade LLM chatbot, and cashless payments, highlighting practical, scalable tech built to protect and empower farmers.

additionalFields.heading: WPS103
additionalFields.title: Quro Medical - Africa’s first tech-driven Hospital at Home
additionalFields.body:
Kevin Pakiry, Senior Solutions Architect, AWS | Joost Pielage, CTO, Quro Medical
14:00 - 14:45
additionalFields.bodyBack: Quro Medical is a digital health company offering Africa’s first tech-driven Hospital at Home, using AWS health technology to analyze real-time data to monitor patient health. Quro Medical aims to build the largest virtual hospital on the African continent offering world-class healthcare at much lower costs.

additionalFields.heading: PTR102
additionalFields.title: Improving Reliability with SLOs
additionalFields.body:
Ajuna Kyaruzi, Manager - SRE & Platform Advocacy, Datadog
12:00 - 12:30
additionalFields.bodyBack: Service Level Objectives (SLOs) measure your service's reliability. This talk will define how to pick SLOs based on customer expectations, system requirements, and user journeys. We'll cover how error budgets and burn rates provide actionable metrics for balancing innovation with reliability, and how SLOs support your organization's development velocity, service management, and incident response.

additionalFields.heading: WIC101
additionalFields.title: Scaling Cloud Fluency: Evolving Cloud Skills into a Strategic Capability - Absa
additionalFields.body:
Amir Shalaby, Principal Specialist, AWS Training & Certifications | Monique Botha, Absa Cloud Incubator Lead, Absa Bank Ltd | Thoko Mathenjwa, Cloud Security Engineer, Absa Bank Ltd
09:00 - 10:15
additionalFields.bodyBack: What began as a focused effort with 600 engaged learners has matured into a dynamic Skill Guild of over 2,500+ members- and growing. With more than 7,000 upskilling opportunities delivered to date, the Cloud Incubator has empowered both technical and non-technical employees to build cloud fluency, drive innovation, and contribute meaningfully to Absa's cloud transformation journey. By leveraging AWS resources, utilising the abilities of the AWS Skill Builder, and a community-driven approach, the Cloud Incubator has delivered measurable value: accelerating capability development, bridging skill gaps across business functions, and cultivating a future-ready workforce. This session will unpack how a Skill Guild became a strategic asset; embedding continuous learning into culture, aligning talent with business priorities, and unlocking the full value of a collaborative partnership.

additionalFields.heading: CH2301
additionalFields.title: AI Meets Support: The Future of AWS Engineering
additionalFields.body:
Emmanuel Mashandudze, Senior Cloud Support Engineer, AWS | Gali Morake, Cloud Support Engineer, AWS | Joseph Phiri, Cloud Support Engineer, AWS
09:30 - 10:15
additionalFields.bodyBack: Explore the dual impact of generative AI in AWS Support: how it's reshaping customer support needs and how we're leveraging AI to enhance our support capabilities. Learn how AWS Support Engineers are adapting to AI-driven workloads while using AI tools to deliver more efficient, innovative solutions for our customers.

additionalFields.heading: SUP207
additionalFields.title: From Days to Minutes: Accelerating Onboarding with Agents and Bedrock
additionalFields.body:
Anshuman Nanda, Senior Startup Solutions Architect, AWS
14:00 - 14:45
additionalFields.bodyBack: How a startup reduced onboarding from days to minutes using GenAI agents and Amazon Bedrock. Discover why smart founders are automating their most resource-intensive touchpoints and how you can eliminate onboarding friction without hiring additional support staff. Walk away with a clear playbook for building intelligent onboarding experiences that scale while protecting your engineering resources.

additionalFields.heading: CH2106
additionalFields.title: Training ML Models for Content Classification: A SageMaker Journey
additionalFields.body: Rennay Dorasamy, Senior Cloud Application Architect, AWS | Carl Du Plessis, Solutions Architect, fuseIT | Michael Du Plessis, Solutions Architect, fuseIT
additionalFields.bodyBack: Join us to explore how we leveraged Amazon SageMaker to analyze social media content at scale. Learn how we built, trained, and compared different ML models - from logistic regression to transformers - to classify content effectively. See real examples of model performance and gain practical insights for your own ML projects. Perfect for data scientists and ML enthusiasts interested in large-scale content analysis.

additionalFields.heading: SUP205
additionalFields.title: GenAI Agents & SaaS: The Next Evolution of Business Software
additionalFields.body:
Alice Wanjohi, Associate Solutions Architect, AWS
15:00 - 15:45
additionalFields.bodyBack: Join us for a technical exploration of how GenAI agents are reshaping traditional SaaS applications. Through real-world architecture examples and implementation patterns, we'll demonstrate the transformation from conventional software to agent-native systems. This session will provide practical insights on integration approaches, performance optimization, and production deployment strategies for building next-generation business applications.

additionalFields.heading: AIM101
additionalFields.title: AI for Good: Building Africa's Digital Future
additionalFields.body:
Ashly Tan, Head of International Social Responsibility and Impact, AWS
09:00 - 09:30
additionalFields.bodyBack: By 2030, the AWS Social Responsibility and Impact (SRI) initiative plans to support 5,000 organizations using cloud and AI technology to positively impact 500 million people worldwide. The SRI initiative focuses on projects in education, health, and climate change. In this talk, you will hear how you can get in involved in using cloud and AI technologies for good in Africa and beyond. Join the movement!

additionalFields.heading: BIZ303
additionalFields.title: Delivering enhanced customer service and reliability with Amazon Connect
additionalFields.body:
Roark Raman, Sr WW Spec Seller Connect | Andrew Baker, Chief Technology Officer, Capitec Bank
12:00 - 12:45
additionalFields.bodyBack: This talk embodies Capitec's vision of democratizing premium banking experiences. By turning service challenges into competitive advantages, they're not just solving problems – they're creating new standards for inclusive banking. The rising customer satisfaction scores validate this approach, showing that technology, when properly implemented, can enhance rather than replace the human touch in banking relationships.

additionalFields.heading: BIZ101
additionalFields.title: How AWS migration & modernization accelerates business transformation
additionalFields.body:
Guy Baulch, Specialist Solutions Architect | Derek Morgan, Managing Executive: IT, Cell C
09:00 - 10:00
additionalFields.bodyBack: Maximize the value of your legacy systems and accelerate your organization’s journey to the cloud. Discover how AWS is revolutionizing migration and modernization, turning complex challenges into opportunities. Explore cutting-edge services that redefine digital transformation, from AI-powered discovery tools to automated refactoring solutions. Learn how industry leaders use these tools to reduce costs, eliminate licensing issues, and speed up innovation. Whether you’re a business decision-maker, IT leader, or technical professional, this session will equip you with strategies to drive your organization’s cloud transformation. Join us to transform your legacy systems into a springboard for innovation with AWS.

additionalFields.heading: CH2102
additionalFields.title: SnapMagic: AI-Powered Trading Card Generation
additionalFields.body: Merlin Naidoo, Technical Account Manager, AWS | Patrick Chen, Cloud Support Engineer, AWS
additionalFields.bodyBack: Transform any AWS event into an unforgettable experience with SnapMagic's AI-powered trading card platform. Using Amazon Bedrock's Nova Canvas and Nova Reel models, attendees can instantly generate personalized professional trading cards and animated videos from simple text prompts. Built on serverless AWS architecture, SnapMagic delivers enterprise-grade scalability while making generative AI accessible to everyone at events literally in the palm of your hands.

additionalFields.heading: TRN203
additionalFields.title: Understand your customers better with a modern data strategy
additionalFields.body:
Mabuya Brightwell Magagula, Senior Technical Trainer,AWS
13:00 - 13:45
additionalFields.bodyBack: We are not only producing more data than ever, we are also producing real-time data that is streaming from a host of sources like social media platforms and sensors embedded in attached to various devices. That data comes in structured and unstructured forms. In this session, explore the AWS services needed to build a complete data solution to store, access, transform, analyze, and predict so you can put your data to work to make better, more informed decisions, respond faster to the unexpected, and uncover new opportunities.

additionalFields.heading: PTN113
additionalFields.title: Outnumbered but Unstoppable: Building an AI‑First Team
additionalFields.body:
Matimba, Nkuna, Founder, Timbuk2 ai | null | null
09:00 - 09:15
additionalFields.bodyBack: See how lean teams use AI agents as a force multiplier—automating code, documents and operations so plain English becomes the command layer. We'll share repeatable patterns like compounding engineering and how combining them with AWS improves speed, quality and sustainability. Leave with a playbook to achieve more with less.

additionalFields.heading: TRN202
additionalFields.title: Exam Prep: AWS Certified Solutions Architect - Associate
additionalFields.body:
Nigel Solomons, Senior AWS Technical Trainer, AWS
12:00 - 12:45
additionalFields.bodyBack: Prepare for the AWS Certified Solutions Architect – Associate exam with this interactive study session. Review the AWS Certified Solutions Architect – Associate Official Practice Question Set, and get your questions answered by the subject matter expert leading the study session.

additionalFields.heading: GAI303
additionalFields.title: All aboard on the MCP Train
additionalFields.body:
Alexandre Pinhel, Prototyping Regional Manager, AWS | Alex Shabala, Head of Data Science, Capitec | Hennie Francis, Cloud Engineer III, Capitec
12:00 - 12:45
additionalFields.bodyBack: Ever wondered how some teams are building AI systems that are faster, cheaper, and more resilient? Join me and I’ll walk you through the power of Model Context Platforms (MCP) and share why they’re becoming a game-changer. You’ll get insights on how MCP can boost your system’s efficiency, streamline workflows, and cut costs—plus, the challenges you need to watch out for.

additionalFields.heading: PTN317
additionalFields.title: From Months to Minutes: Streamline Vendor Compliance with Blink
additionalFields.body:
Trevor Naidoo
13:40 - 13:55
additionalFields.bodyBack: Vendor compliance is often slow, fragmented, and manual. In this session, explore how Blink—a cloud-based vendor management system—helps organizations reduce onboarding timelines from months to minutes. Learn how Blink centralizes supplier data, automates compliance tracking, and supports real-time reporting to meet supply chain, B-BBEE, and sustainability goals.

additionalFields.heading: CH1301
additionalFields.title: Modernisation with AWS Support
additionalFields.body:
Nataizya Sikasote, Cloud Support Engineer, AWS | Maureen Barasa, Cloud Support Engineer, AWS | Jenade Moodley, Cloud Support Engineer, AWS
09:30 - 10:15
additionalFields.bodyBack: Discover how AWS Support can help guide your cloud modernization journey, whether you are preparing to migrate to the cloud, already using cloud services but looking to optimize performance, or seeking general guidance on your cloud adoption. Organizations often face common challenges during cloud migration and optimization, including complexity of workload migration, security and compliance requirements, cost management, and performance optimization. Learn how AWS Support leverages various processes across different phases of your cloud journey - from initial assessment and planning, through migration and deployment, to ongoing optimisation and operations - ensuring your specific needs are addressed at each stage of cloud adoption.

additionalFields.heading: CH2105
additionalFields.title: Payments Platform at Scale: Processing 10M transactions daily
additionalFields.body: Maureen Kathure, Solutions Architect, AWS | Francis Wilson, CIO, Hubtel | Augustine Gyawu Adjei, Head of Engineering, Hubtel
additionalFields.bodyBack: Hubtel has grown into Ghana’s largest mobile payments platform after the company migrated from an inflexible and unreliable on-premises infrastructure to AWS. Traffic spikes were affecting platform performance because it was taking too long to scale its infrastructure. The company migrated to AWS using Amazon EC2, Amazon RDS, and Amazon EKS. Hubtel’s infrastructure now scales easily to meet demand. It has increased revenue by 20 times and improved performance 100 times, while saving $1.5 million annually on infrastructure costs.

additionalFields.heading: DAT307
additionalFields.title: Build your data strategy for generative AI with Amazon Redshift
additionalFields.body:
Syed Humair, Sr. Analytics Specialist Solutions Architect, AWS
16:00 - 16:45
additionalFields.bodyBack: Data warehouses are crucial for generative AI development. Amazon Redshift's domain data enables RAG, fine-tuning foundation models, continuous pretraining, and building new models. Users can leverage built-in AI features like Amazon Q to generate SQL code using natural language in the Redshift query editor, boosting productivity and accelerating insights. Learn how to harness Amazon Redshift for your generative AI applications and workloads.

additionalFields.heading: STU106
additionalFields.title: AWS Learning Resources for Career Development
additionalFields.body:
Nigel Solomons, AWS
16:00 - 16:45
additionalFields.bodyBack: AWS offers three learning platforms to advance your cloud computing skills. The AWS Skill Center provides free in person and virtual foundational training, AWS Educate delivers free, curated learning path to in-demand tech skills, access to Emerging Talent Community and the Job Board. AWS Skill Builder offers self-paced digital courses and professional certification preparation. These platforms help you develop professional cloud computing expertise and prepare for industry certifications.

additionalFields.heading: OIS302
additionalFields.title: Deep Dive into data protection architectures for Amazon Bedrock Agents.
additionalFields.body:
Andrew Kane, GenAI Security/Compliance Lead | Onaopemipo Osunyomi, Solutions Architect, AWS
13:00 - 13:45
additionalFields.bodyBack: How Amazon Bedrock protects your data across Agents and related features, such as Knowledge Bases and Guardrails. Learn about security considerations for cross-region deployments, multi-agent collaboration, and prompt caching. Gain deep insights into architecting secure generative AI solutions that maintain data protection, and discover architectural patterns that keep your applications safe and secure.

additionalFields.heading: COM107
additionalFields.title: Certify with Confidence: Exam Prep Tips & AWS Community Insights
additionalFields.body:
Ntombizakhona Mabaso, Web & Cloud Developer at Bamboo Charcoal Computing
16:00 - 16:45
additionalFields.bodyBack: This talk is a practical guide for anyone looking to earn their first (or next) AWS certification—with help from the AWS community. Drawing from personal experience, I’ll outline a 360-degree approach to exam prep: from selecting the right certification to using tools like AWS Skill Builder, the QA Platform, and free tier labs. I’ll also share how the AWS Community Builders program gave me technical mentorship, credits, and access to a global network that kept me accountable and motivated. Attendees will walk away with actionable steps to prep smarter, not harder—and learn how to tap into AWS’s growing support ecosystem.

additionalFields.heading: CH2103
additionalFields.title: Building EC2: Inside AWS Cape Town Engineering
additionalFields.body: Jethro Moller, Software Development Engineer, AWS | Tai Lucas, Principal System Development Engineer, AWS
additionalFields.bodyBack: Join AWS EC2 engineers for an insider’s view of building and operating one of the world’s largest compute platforms. Experience a day in our Cape Town engineering centre, where we’ll share our development practices, operational excellence, and innovation culture. Discover how our teams collaborate globally while solving complex challenges that impact millions of customers. Get unique perspectives on engineering at AWS scale from the team that helps power the cloud.

additionalFields.heading: STU104
additionalFields.title: Why Get AWS Certified?
additionalFields.body:
Thembelani Sigala Mhlanga, AWS
14:00 - 14:45
additionalFields.bodyBack: You’ll learn about the advantages of getting AWS Certified. You’ll also learn about the various certifications offered by AWS and what the AWS Skills Centers and other AWS programs have available to help you prepare to take these certification exams.

additionalFields.heading: AIM202
additionalFields.title: Unleashing the Power: How Momentum Life Insurance revolutionises cost and performance with Bedrock Inference Models
additionalFields.body:
Shantal Varathan, Technical Account Manager, AWS | Leon du Plessis, UI/UX Architect, Momentum Group
09:45 - 10:15
additionalFields.bodyBack: Join us to discover how Momentum Life Insurance is transforming the AI landscape by leveraging Amazon Bedrock's inference modes. Learn how organizations are achieving dramatic cost savings while simultaneously boosting performance metrics. This game-changing approach delivers exponential benefits that you can implement today. Don't miss this opportunity to revolutionize your AI operations and gain a competitive edge!

additionalFields.heading: CH2304
additionalFields.title: Demystifying AWS Networking: Ingress, Egress, and Everything In Between
additionalFields.body:
Daniel Mutale, Delivery Practice Manager, AWS | Tshepo Keele, Delivery Consultant, AWS | Bubonke Matandela, Delivery Consultant, AWS
13:00 - 13:45
additionalFields.bodyBack: This session provides a clear and practical overview of networking in Amazon Web Services (AWS), focusing on how to design and manage secure network architectures within a Landing Zone. We will explore ingress and egress traffic patterns, internet connectivity, Domain Name System (DNS) resolution, and firewall configurations. The session will also cover how to perform traffic inspection and integrate third-party networking and security tools within your AWS environment. With real-world examples and best practices, this session is ideal for cloud architects, security engineers, and platform teams looking to build secure, scalable, and well-governed AWS networking foundations.

additionalFields.heading: GAI202
additionalFields.title: Amazon Q Developer Professional in practice
additionalFields.body:
Mayowa Amao, Solutions Architect, AWS | Liani Van Nieuwenhuizen, Head of Technology Strategy, Absa |
Gerdus Smit, Lead Platform Engineer, Absa
09:45 - 10:15
additionalFields.bodyBack: Harnessing the power of Amazon Q Developer Professional to accelerate the integration of new services like Amazon Bedrock within a serverless architecture. This tool ensures effortless translation between coding languages and supports the development of solutions from scratch. Additionally, it facilitates the transition of security requirements from Active Directory Federation Services (ADFS) to OAuth for web applications

additionalFields.heading: AIM205
additionalFields.title: Enhance your document processing workflow with Amazon Bedrock Data Automation
additionalFields.body:
Louise Liddell, Senior Solutions Architect, AWS
14:00 - 14:45
additionalFields.bodyBack: Intelligent document processing serves use cases ranging from insurance claims processing to media asset management, advertising, and compliance. Amazon Bedrock Data Automation is a new gen AI–powered capability that transforms unstructured content from documents, images, video, and audio into structured data at scale. It enables simple customization of outputs to generate specific insights in formats compatible with existing systems. We will explore how the service can enhance and complement your existing workflows. Join this breakout session to learn how Amazon Bedrock Data Automation can help you transform your unstructured content into actionable insights.

additionalFields.heading: DAT406
additionalFields.title: Get started with Amazon Aurora DSQL
additionalFields.body:
Vuyisa Maswana, Solutions Architect, AWS
15:00 - 15:45
additionalFields.bodyBack: Amazon Aurora DSQL is a new relational database that combines the best of serverless experience, Amazon Aurora performance, and Amazon DynamoDB scale. Aurora DSQL's distributed architecture is designed to make it effortless for organizations of any size to manage distributed workloads with strong consistency. This session guides you through the fundamentals of Aurora DSQL. Learn how Aurora DSQL can work within your architecture, understand key considerations and tradeoffs, explore what an application architecture could look like, and more.

additionalFields.heading: SUP204
additionalFields.title: From 90min to Real-Time: Startup Cuts AI Costs 70% with Inferentia
additionalFields.body:
Saubia Khan, Startup Solutions Architect, AWS
13:00 - 13:45
additionalFields.bodyBack: One startup cut AI costs by 70% and eliminated 90-minute processing delays using AWS Inferentia chips. Discover why smart founders are ditching expensive GPU infrastructure and how you can achieve enterprise-grade AI performance without the enterprise price tag. Walk away with a clear playbook for scaling your AI features while protecting your runway.

additionalFields.heading: PTN206
additionalFields.title: Revolutionising Resiliency and maintaining business operations
additionalFields.body:
Mohamed Dawood | Sunny Vandeyar
09:40 - 09:55
additionalFields.bodyBack: Deliver a proven, intelligent, enterprise-grade data protection platform that scales to secure any workload across on-prem, edge, and hybrid multi-cloud. Features include user self-service, integration with Azure/AWS, ransomware protection, malware scanning, threat analysis, immutable storage (WORM), encryption, isolation, and air gapping.

additionalFields.heading: TRN104
additionalFields.title: Exam Prep: AWS Certified AI Practitioner
additionalFields.body:
Nigel Solomons, Senior AWS Technical Trainer, AWS
14:00 - 14:45
additionalFields.bodyBack: Prepare for the AWS Certified AI Practitioner exam with this study session. Review questions from the official practice question set. Ask questions of the subject matter expert leading the study session. Continue preparing for your exam with confidence following the four-step plan on AWS Skill Builder.

additionalFields.heading: OIS201
additionalFields.title: AWS security at scale: From development to production
additionalFields.body:
Lee Moodley, Snr Solutions Architect, AWS | Recep Meric Degirmenci, Specialist Security Solutions Architect, AWS
12:00 - 12:45
additionalFields.bodyBack: Discover how to enhance your cloud security posture across the entire development and production lifecycle. This session explores the AWS comprehensive security approach, covering identification, prevention, detection, response, and remediation. Learn to integrate security-by-design principles throughout your development process and use advanced detection and response capabilities. Explore how generative AI enhances security analysis and automates operations. Gain insights into building resilient architectures that evolve with emerging threats, enabling you to create more secure, scalable cloud environments.
